dt: {bc}having lost former closeness and affection {bc}in a state of {d_link|alienation|alienation} from a previous close or familial relationship

dt.t: her {wi}estranged{/wi} husband {gloss}=her husband with whom she no longer lives{/gloss}
Social workers may try to resolve conflicts between {wi}estranged{/wi} siblings.
He had taken out a life insurance policy on his {wi}estranged{/wi} wife just weeks before her murder …
… it's kind of shameful to admit your idea of unwinding in front of the TV is watching somebody's entire family get murdered by their greedy, {wi}estranged{/wi} uncle.

shortdef: having lost former closeness and affection : in a state of alienation from a previous close or familial relationship

dt: {bc}to arouse especially mutual enmity or indifference in (someone) where there had formerly been love, affection, or friendliness {bc}{sx|alienate||}

dt.t: John's excesses gradually {wi}estranged{/wi} him from his mother …

dt: {bc}to remove from customary environment or associations

dt.t: The first words spoken were not those of one becoming {wi}estranged{/wi} from this world, and already permitted to stray at times into realms foreign to the living.

pt: {sc}estrange{/sc} {sc}alienate{/sc} {sc}disaffect{/sc} mean to cause one to break a bond of affection or loyalty. {sc}estrange{/sc} implies the development of indifference or hostility with consequent separation or divorcement.
{sc}alienate{/sc} may or may not suggest separation but always implies loss of affection or interest.
{sc}disaffect{/sc} refers especially to those from whom loyalty is expected and stresses the effects (such as rebellion or discontent) of alienation without actual separation.

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French {it}estrangir, estranger{/it}, from Medieval Latin {it}extraneare{/it}, from Latin {it}extraneus{/it} strange {ma}{mat|strange:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: to arouse especially mutual enmity or indifference in (someone) where there had formerly been love, affection, or friendliness : alienate
to remove from customary environment or associations

dt: {bc}a married couple who no longer live together

shortdef: a married couple who no longer live together

dt: {bc}a husband who no longer lives with his wife

shortdef: a husband who no longer lives with his wife

dt: {bc}a wife who no longer lives with her husband

shortdef: a wife who no longer lives with her husband
